lines.text: Black as midnight, black as pitch, blacker than the foulest witch.
Oh, Mother Night! Fold your dark arms about me. Protect me in your black embrace. I sit alone, an impotent exile, whilst this form, this presence, returns to torment me!
The dreams of youth are the regrets of maturity.
You are nothing but an animal!

[laughs]
We are all animals m'lady.
I require the solace of the shadows and the dark of the night. Sunshine is my destroyer.
You think you have won! What is light without dark? What are you without me? I am a part of you all. You can never defeat me. We are brothers eternal!
I... I must be dreaming...
If life is a dream, better you dread the waking!
This place holds more magic for me than any palace in the world.
May be innocent, may be sweet... ain't half as nice as rotting meat.
What care I for human hearts? Soft and spiritless as porridge! A faerie's heart beats fierce and free!
I vote we run like hell.
I second the motion.
What a fine fat boy you are, Jack!
You don't really mean to eat me, do you, ma'am?
Oh, indeed I do!
[cackles]
That would be a shame because someone as fair and lovely as yourself, Miss Meg, deserves far better than scrawny me. Don't you think?
Think me fair, do you, Jack?
All the heavenly angels must envy your beauty.

[cackles]
What a fine meal you'll make, be the rest of you as sweet as your tongue!
[cackles]
Every wolf suffers fleas. 'Tis easy enough to scratch!
I hear a throat begging to be cut!
Are you so eager to see blood flow?
As eager as you are to drink it!
Are you afraid to kiss me, Jack?
I'm afraid you'll break my heart.
Then still your heart, for you are dear to me as life itself.
What is light without dark?
[playing with the unicorn's horn]
Higher, higher, burning fire, making music like a choir!
Father, protect me!

[to Blix]
You only got the shot in 'cause the Princess was there! Wrong! 'Twas Beauty led the Beast to bay!
She was so sweet, I could eat her brains like jam!
I could suck her bones...
Enough! Better hurry. Dark Lord, he don't like to wait.
[the goblins spy on the unicorns]

[pointing]
Look! Ugly one-horned mule!
Mortal world turned to ice... Here be goblin paradise!
[repeated line]
I trust you, Lily.
There's only one thing I want to know.
What?
WHY ME?
Neither country proverb nor King's command could keep me from the woods, today.
Magic horn is mine, mine, mine! Now all creatures will love the night, and worship goblins as divine.
You shouldn't talk like that, Blix.
Why not? I've got the power now.

[spits]
Plenty big puff!
Eat... Drink...
I do nothing for your pleasure!
Higher higher, burning fire, making music like a choir.
This shot be just as sweet as pie.
How do you know my name?
[cranes head away in annoyance from Oona, who is buzzing around his head]
Stop it! Go away!

I know everything, Jack. Yet I do not understand what has happened today. Suppose you tell me, Jack? You know these woods as well as any elf. Did you not see something odd today, any strange spirits? Did nothing untoward happen?
I took Lily to see the unicorn...

[In outrage]
You did WHAT?
[the other elves chatter noisily]
SILENCE!
[They hush]
[Look what we have been through. Look who you are. Have faith in yourself. It is the greatest lesson you have learned]
Goblins... shot me through me brain pan.
That's one place an arrow won't do no harm!

[solves the riddle]
Flowers...? Bluebells! To hear them ring, it means your life is at an end!
A Human laid hands upon a Unicorn! Jack!
Love you say? Well, love is another matter.
Holy lightening strikes all that's evil/ teaching us to love for goodness sake.
You all look like mourners at your own funeral.
You willful sprite! How dare you keep such secrets?
They're mine to keep.
